qas.question: What geographic form is Palermo surrounded by?
Which author desribed Monte Pelegrino as "The most beautiful promontory in the world?"
Which is the tallest mountain in Sicily?
Where is Monte Pellegrino in relation to other peaks?

answers.text: geographically separated from the rest of the range by a plain

qas.question: What city is surrounded by valleys?
Why is it difficult to reach Palermo from Sicily?
Which mountain is seperated from the rest of the range by a valley?
Who described Monte Pellegrino in the 1900's

context: <b4_0>Palermo<b4_0/> is surrounded by <a0_0>mountains<a0_0/>, formed of calcar, which form a cirque around the city. Some districts of the city are divided by the mountains themselves. Historically, it was relatively difficult to reach the inner part of Sicily from the city because of the <b5_0>mounts<b5_0/>. The tallest peak of the range is <a2_0><b6_0>La Pizzuta<b6_0/><a2_0/>, about 1,333 m (4,373 ft.) high. However, historically, the most important mount is <b7_0>Monte Pellegrino<b7_0/>, which is <a3_0>geographically separated from the rest of the range by a plain<a3_0/>. The mount lies right in front of the Tyrrhenian Sea. Monte Pellegrino's cliff was described in the 19th century by <a1_0><b8_0>Johann Wolfgang von Goethe,<b8_0/><a1_0/> as "The most beautiful promontory in the world", in his essay "Italian Journey".
